V-LPIh6L6s00XenH-jOM3g.text: was really excited about going here but was a bit disappointed. the menu was different from that on the internet, so the choice i wanted was not available. i went for a burger in the end, and it was really average. They also charged £30 quid for a cocktail pitcher that was half ice! On the plus side, the service was extremely friendly and attentive.

YggwuO7ZTq0pjo_XIsj6_w.text: We finally got around to trying the Big Easy last Saturday and the verdict -  slightly disappointed with the food.I tried the triple Combi with Half rack of Ribs, 1/4 BBQ Chicken and 3 Jumbo grilled Prawns, plus a side order of Onion Rings. The ribs and chicken was well cooked but the meat lacked flavour, luckily it came with plenty of BBQ sauce. The prawns where ok but the onion rings where extra salty! :/ That and 1 drink cost around 30 pounds. 12.5% service is added to your bill.This places has a nice atmosphere, it's cosy and very busy, so book in advance. The service was good, and portions are big!

yDh7fsDZLRgyj7nwu20gHw.text: I can't believe it's taken me so long to get round to reviewing this place The Big Easy has to be one of the funniest places in London! Live bands, upbeat & friend waiters and there's usually a birthday party or two going on. The food comes is large American-Style portionsall of it delicious! I love it hear an am always recommending my friends to come.

photos.caption: Photo of Big Easy - London, United Kingdom

0SbZwWQvF_m-mJqSxywn8Q.text: We went to the Big Easy for my wife's birthday, as she was craving some American Style food.  We were early for our reservation so we had drinks at the bar.  It was happy hour so there were lots of 2 for 1 deals on drinks and specials on pitchers as well.  My wife said her frozen Margaritas were tasty.  They were from a machine, but for a frozen margarita this isn't uncommon.  The atmosphere was fun, noisy, but not too loud to talk.  The bar had ESPN on showing baseball.  We were seated on the ground floor, but it sounded like there was live music in the basement.Typically American appetizers were on the menu, and we split an order of Potato skins with bacon (American style crispy bacon) which were the best we've had in London.  I also had a bowl of the New England Clam Chowder they had that day, which was very good, but much larger than I was expecting (It's a good thing I came hungry).  We both ordered one of the special offers for the day for our main course.  Prices on the regular menu looked to be a little expensive, but the portions described were pretty large, so overall not too bad.  Our special included a 200g (7oz for the Americans reading this) steak topped with a couple onion rings, a skewer of three large shrimp, french fries, and half a bottle of red wine for £14.95.  The steak was cooked exactly as ordered and was very tender.  The shrimp was also delicious.Overall, we will definitely go back when we are craving an American style meal.  We left absolutely stuffed and very happy.

3uhYRIkOzIGrWVeV5cDsVA.text: Big Easy is the sort of place you'll either love or hate. Based on the full house of our Monday night visit, lots of folks seem to love it very much. With its biggest and the best AYCE Americana approach to face stuffing (one of the dessert dishes is a basket of four Krispy Kreme doughnuts with hot chocolate fondue), Big Easy leans heavily on the more is more philosophy when it comes to serving its patrons. There's some decent food on the menu  I like the voodoo chicken wings and think their daily lobster special (is it still on?) is good value for money. If you like your grub served in a mildly raucous (eg too loud for quality convo) crabshack atmosphere, Big Easy is the place for you. More about that lobster special:londonist.com/2010/05/re…

Oco63K7CDyn0jfrjgXoZtw.text: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE. This is an amazing Chelsea hangout for young and old. The food is amazing. The service incredible and the specials are OUT OF THIS WORLD. If you like food that is the next best thing to a Canadian BBQ or a Texas hoedown well look not further. Two step over to the Big Easy and grab all you can eat deep fried shrimps, BBQ or fajitas. Reasonable prices for endless amounts of food. Highly recommended.

WiUWditPecPMBLe4j6pCaQ.text: Noisy and fun!!!! I loved this place. The food was good - food you can really get your fingers into. Its a Crabshack for gods sake...Earl Hicky would feel right at home.This place is good for groups and families. If you do go out on a date here it will be to show you are more of a fun kinda guy or gal. It is  not a quiet romantic venue so you can forget that.It can get busy so try and book. The price was fair also.

at2Mr1kdsiIedjmNW48obA.text: I had a big craving for fattening american food and my friend thomas and I had seen the big easy when we walked past it on a most recent shopping spree. The food was good, and the portions were big, and I was glad that we decided to go once we got there. I was a little late so my friends ordered marg's while they were waiting for me and they said that they were a little disappointed by them b/c they were from a machine. I got a chicken sandwich with avocado, and my friend got this meal that included a beer, chicken wings, fries and a burger for £9.95. It was a pretty big meal. but they were out of a lot of other items on the menu. By the end of the meal I was beyond stuffed to the point of needing a nap. oh Also they had my favorite hef Blue Moon, it was £5 but it was totally worth it just for one delicious walk down memory lane.

OzdlRXV6gEAFr8RSvUBj1A.text: A good place for an evening out with a group of friends. Friendly service and lively atmosphere over a casual grilled American dinner. The seafood is quite good, not so much the burgers (you would expect better from a typical American place), but quite pricey for what it is. It is a fun night out.

0PzPmqWyjhv1VUcGsa2B6Q.text: There are two ways to go on this, American food is awful or we got took by the "special" scam. Regardless of the route, the destination is the same, this is possibly the worst meal I've eaten at a restaurant. I went to Big Easy with an old friend, who chose the restaurant on the recommendation of her friend. After entering the restaurant, being greeted and seated I noticed that the prices were high. High double digits for what seemed a casual dining restaurant. At this point our helpful waiter suggested the special, lobster and steak for less than 20 sterling. It seemed like a good deal so we took it, and 15 minutes later our fair dining experience was in the toilet. The steak was not horrible, it was like the steaks at Outback Steakhouse, it was important to be hungry. Not bad, but nothing special. The lobster was the true disappointment, it looked horrible and the taste was bleh. I am not a seafood person, so I admit to some bias  but my friend also quit eating after a few bites and spent the rest of the meal picking at fries. Fries which were grocery store frozen fries, and a bit stale.In short, horrible meal.

A_4UYo2zuXLhzxx0RPuytg.text: Now I know what Europeans think American themed restaurants are supposed to be like.  They definitely got the portion sizes right - you certainly won't go home hungry!  The food was pretty good, just not exceptional.  Definitely a case of trying to recreate what you can get in a good bbq place in the US without completely succeeding.  The atmosphere is great though, and you'll still have a fun time.  You'll look around and see a lot of people dressed up and on their way to the Chelsea clubs, but you'll probably have BBQ sauce all over yourself by the end of the night, so if clubbing is your plan try somewhere else.

kJR6q50HC8MKyX5xYwv1Ag.text: Great atmosphere, great specials! Can you really go wrong with the surf and turf special or the all you can eat BBQ?!?

0HxWmsjzLX8-3r1yYpQCPw.text: There are often £15 specials on lobster dinners, which are not bad at all. Interesting decor, the business cards tacked to the walls are at times quite entertaining. Great cocktail selection, quick and easy, haven't left disappointed yet.

9X6na_XOh82lB47_y3Jcpg.text: American fast food, fast, unhealthy, that shouldn't be eaten. These describe the food served there, but c'on we live once. I love this place. Any time I go there I know that it's wrong and that I shouldn't eat this crap, but this is the most tasty and delicious crap in London. You can get addicted to it very easy so be ware! If you are not from Chelsea, but your have something around King's Rd and of course, you have nothing against to harm your health a bit, I strongly recommend this place!

iRP5hslJaLYg_ae26G2DVw.text: Took some American friends here last night to celebrate 4th July and boy was I glad we booked. Arrived at 7.45 for an 8pm booking and still had to wait until about 8.20 to be seated. Noted that people arriving to eat without a booking were looking at a two hour wait. Despite the fact that we were surrounded by plates of half eaten ribs (the 6.30pm rib eating competition had just finished) when we arrived and that we had to stand in a fairly cramped area near the bar for our table to be ready, it was definitely worth the wait. Everyone was very happy with the width and breadth of choice on the menu, which included American classic after American classic. It was hard to choose from the plethora of steaks, burgers, ribs, BBQ'd prawns, lobster, crab etc. And even though we didn't end up eating until 9pm, we were kept entertained by the house band and pleasant (if but fairly slow) water/waitress service. After dating an American for 2 years and having eaten food from the US on both sides of the pond I can safely say that the Big Easy is by far the most authentic American dining experience I've come across in London. I can definitely recommend a night out at the Big Easy, if only for the food and entertainment alone. However, don't come here expecting a quick in and out meal. I'd definitely set aside a fair portion of your day and stomach. :)

ta6sBlWvw2BLCC0Mk-YA3Q.text: If you are an American living in London and you want a little taste of home, this is a great place to go. The food isn't wonderful but the combination of sports on TV, the lobster vests, live band and checkered table clothes, just cries out 'welcome home' to me. =)It is usually a bit of a wait for a table, but there is a bar area to wait in and the margarita's are pretty good. There is seating upstairs and downstairs. If you want to be able to easily hear your dinner companions it is best to get a table upstairs. Downstairs, when the band is playing, you will have to strain to hear, or yell. During the summer there are a few tables outside which are great. Although, I love any sort of outdoor seating in London!

yTRyuJ-Ja5F2cMwXcnzgZw.text: As an American, I shouldn't like cheesy, US themed restaurants but this one is A-Ok in my book. Luckily for them, they centered around New Orleans which is one of my favorite cities and food cultures. The service was fast considering that we had a medium sized group, but apparently the waitress made a quip to a friend of mine about the length of time we were there. On a Friday night when there are drinks, food and a live band (that only came on as we were leaving...) why did they expect us to rush in and out? Who knows... I ordered a lighter option- the BBQ chicken salad, but it was tasty. The ribs that my husband ordered were good and had just the right amount of sauce.

KXOYviT5TTIWpRF4GrQU7Q.text: I love this place! great food, great value for money good margaritas. If you're on King's Road you can't go wrong!

u47GcDxYdOKY8bVWGlg4rQ.text: Upgrading my review as I have received some excellent customer service since our less than impressive visit. The management have been forthright and keen to make amends. I'm hoping to post a review very soon of a positive experience.

rLT3zMwTRNW2rKEmqwrZyQ.text: Big Easy, Chelsea, was a nice relax venue, which has a live band downstairs in the evenings. The all-you-can-eat shrimp was very tasty and good value for money. However, the full rack of baby back ribs was very dry  it was as if it had been already cooked and just reheated on the BBQ to order which unsurprisingly would have dried it out; not impressed. Overall, had a good time, nice food, pleasant service; and will return to try the Lobster feast.

1ftc8bVeQwIUmBTVxypMbQ.text: Nothing at all like New Orleans, but the service was friendly, the food was delicious, and the prices weren't outlandish. This cannot be said for most places in Chelsea.I had the catch of the day: a 2lb. Nova Scotia lobster and the fiance had a surf and turf selection of a small steak and 1/2 a smaller lobster. We both enjoyed them. Having never had a whole lobster before, I expressed my concerns to my waiter who assured me I'd be fine. The lobster arrived cleaved down the center, which was great for a first-time lobster conquerer. While my fiance's half lobster was fine, mine did seem like it could have used a touch longer in the pot as the tomalley was a bit gooey (not that I was going anywhere near it, but I do know it should be firm). Still fine, though. Drawn butter was extra, but only 50p. Fair enough. The wait on a busy Sunday night (without a reservation) was about 20-25 minutes, which was quite reasonable considering it's not a big place. There was live music being played downstairs and piped through the whole place. A fun atmosphere. A bit loud, but nothing terrible. Definitely a place to return to!

irINRgEGbzdHZ27jydr1CA.text: I love this place... it is Canadian, and it has great food, and a fun vibe. We had steak, lobster, crab claws, poppers, calamari, margaritas, chocolate cake... and there was live music. We sat downstairs where the music is and we loved it!

SHHQlLtYM_6HrEUpgwTgJA.text: The atmosphere in this restaurant is great, it's relaxed, comfortable and inviting. Not pretentious at all. The service is second to none. Always friendly, willing to banter with you and not intimidating but professional.This is one of few restaurants I've been to more than once and the service/ food has been impeccable every time. It doesn't matter if you go in a big group or a small group the staff take care of you. Never get orders wrong and even put up with jovial behaviour the group I was with displayed after a few drinks.They almost always have singers performing and the music is decent, it adds to the atmosphere. You can eat for less but I doubt very much you get this quality cheaper, not to mention the portions are big. My favourite's are the lobster, the steak and the ribs. There isn't much space because this restaurant has been busy every night I've been there. It doesn't seem to matter whether it's a Thursday Friday, Saturday, or Sunday, it's constantly busy. You will have to wait to be seated and the food will take some time to get to your table but when you're in a group and the conversation is flowing you might not be so bothered.I've booked a table in advance and turned up without booking so for me this place is worth the wait, but I would not recommend going without booking a table in advance if you want to make sure you can eat there. This is arguably one of my favourite restaurants in London, you will not be disappointed with the food or atmosphere you be sure of that much.

aRBVyrAvx-4lV-AYAWNOkw.text: Not sure how to go about rating this place...As an American, well, lol smh. Just no. I don't trust places that call themselves bbq anything but don't serve beef ribs, among other things.As an American who has come to realize that while in London I will not get the type, and portions, of food I am used to (and love)... the place isn't too bad.Went on a Monday evening. There was quite a wait for a table so we, party of 3 plus a kid, took a smaller bar table. I'd recommend reservations.We ordered all you can eat big pig, king crab legs, St. Louis spareribs, voodoo wings, mac & cheese, and kid's ribs.The portions are damn good compared to what I have seen since being here (except the crab, more on that later). However, the meat is not seasoned, at all. It's cooked plain, THEN they throw some bbq sauce on it. That's not how you do it, guys. All you can eat was fine. Chicken was pretty good. Bbq baked beans. Ahhh. Canned, but, I haven't had any in months, so it seemed like heaven. *cue images of the 'Bush's baked beans' dog trying to sell me the recipe*The crab legs? Don't bother, it was about 2 king crab legs, cut up and scattered on a plate to make it appear to be more than it was. 22 pounds for that? Negative. It was sent back for crab shack combo, except there weren't any crab claws or mussels left. Crab shack combo then became the shrimp basket. The shrimp were pretty big, typical battered deal. Zero taste though. Tarter sauce helped a bit, but, well, no.St.. Louis ribs are supposed to be meatier than regular ribs, but,  *whispers* they lie. Bottom of the slab didn't even have sauce on it. The kids ribs came with sauce on the side? Como? Que? No bueno. My son, a bbq monster, was not happy lol. I wish I had a picture of the look of sheer confusion on his face. He dug in anyway but only ate 2 ribs then filled up on fries. The idea of having to dip the ribs in sauce is just wrong; It's not a chicken finger.Voodoo wings were decent, you only get 5 though. I was pretty shocked by that. The mac & cheese was ok too. The vibe was nice though. Laid back. I'd go back for drinks with friends and maybe have something to eat, but definitely won't be returning just for food.

aSn0avF0DgDUjCx6SwL18Q.text: Very so so. I didn't enjoy much!Service is slow, and forgetful - 40 mins to receive our wine, we ordered 6 lobster festivals (easy to remember, innit!) and waitress forgot and came back to ask after 20 mins. And despite all the lobster, we had to beg to have lobster crackers and forks. Now... the food: lobster really wasn't greatly cooked. And the frozen margaritas just so so.

88QM-Kxd12Km-u1J9xkiTA.text: This is one of my favourite all American restaurants and I have probably been here far too many times in the past year- they do serve great lobster! I'm never disappointed with this place; the service is usually great as is the food, but unfortunately this was not the case the last time I went. We had had a fantastic starter and main, but then when we came to order our dessert we were told that we only had 10 minutes left till it was time to vacate our table. Under normal circumstances this would be fine, but had the service been more efficient and had we not had to wait for over 20 minutes for our plates to be cleared, we would not have had this issue. £70 later, we left feeling slightly deflated. Better luck next time!

-KwYdGO1YXLctvSecUe6DA.text: The Big Easy is a great place to go if you do one thing before you get there - manage your own expectations.If you've got any friends who have been to the Big Easy, they will have waxed lyrical about the food, the ambience, the food, the atmosphere and finally the huge portions of food. None of this is incorrect - the food is fantastic (calamari is solid, the steaks are hefty to say the least and for those of us who are not so much brave as stupid the two person desserts are incredible) and the ambience really is stellar if you get the night right. There is a band that play downstairs pretty regularly, typically a Wednesday/Thursday/Sunday who have the same set list every time they play (doesn't particularly bother me as I'm still listening to Ocean Colour Scene roughly 18 years since they were relevant) who really are good, and the bloke in the group sings happy birthday in whichever musical genre you wish (ask for opera. It's genius). It's also, for where it is located really good for price - steaks are better in my opinion than the MPW just down the road and are cheaper, and the all you can eat nights are epic (although you do occasionally have to remind the waiters that they should bring out the same size portion each time you ask for more - beware the shrinking portions).That said, there are a few things that occasionally leave a bit of a sour taste in the mouth, especially for first timers to The Big Easy, and hence, manage your own expectations. The Big Easy is REALLY busy. Even on a Sunday, you will have to book quite a sizeable time in advance, and it isn't just busy, but B.U.S.Y and slightly cramped. You won't have a huge table, and you won't really be getting a huge amount of personal space for the next 90 minutes (this is the sacrifice you make when you get a great atmosphere). Food can also, because it is so busy, occasionally take a little bit longer than you were anticipating, so be ready for this. All in all though, if you can accept that this place is here for three main reasons - big portions of food, great/loud atmosphere and the experience and can put aside any pretence that you're going to be having a reserved, candle-lit meal you're onto a winner and you won't find many places that serve better food more consistently.Also, I don't care what anyone says, hearing KT Tunstall's opus "suddenly I see" being belted out just before a guy goes operatic on "Happy Birthday" never gets old.(This place is good for groups if you can book in advance and get the downstairs room - you can be as loud and boisterous as you want and you get slightly quicker service in my experience on the all you can eat ribs)

BiePw2aKlkMnLPYu9wG1lg.text: BIG EASY was a lot of fun my friends and I went (three girls) to eat, laugh, and have a great time. We had to book a week and a half in advance though, so as previous reviews have stated to book early and do not just show up on a Saturday or Sunday executing to be seated within 1hr.

eOM8mElmW2_2sqwPK_hsTQ.text: Surfed and Turfed here, 4 stars! we came here in a huge group for a friend's birthday and all ordered the surf and turf.. Thursday special only £20! the surf went well, juicy and slightly above average lobster, i killed it first. the turf was just okay.. i did just recently have the l'entrecote steak though, so those are high standards to live up to. the decor is extreme and cheesy, decked with american license plates and star spangled banners and even a live 2-man "band" crooning sweet home alabama in the background. we made it to desserts and the waffles were actually really good. reminiscent of bubba gump restaurant at home!

WC6K1UhwPOVt7VYZr1pjHA.text: Ive been 3times and never been let down. Great food atmosphere and service. Brilliant value for money too, massive thumbs up from me!

EOtCE_n2QtirEjKVbRY0KA.text: Delicious, come hungry and leave 10lbs heavier because how can you not want to gorge yourself with so much great food available !The big hit at our table was the lobster special for £15, it comes with a nice frosty margarita ! I had the potato skins with bacon and then followed that carbfest up with the chili lime chicken fajitas, everything was delish - the only thing missing was a wheel barrel to cart my fat ass out the door when I was done !I would absolutely make an effort to go here again when I'm next in town, the live music and great service were big pluses in my book !

d56BZBG5thlF0eunmj-2lg.text: How have I not been here since I moved to London 2 years ago!?  Whole lobster, fries, side salad AND a margarita for 14.95 pounds, I'm going back there every chance I get!!  Went on a Sunday at 3pm and had to wait 30 min for a table for 2, not so bad with the frozen margaritas on TAP....a dream.Jalapenos poppers, mac 'n' cheese, buffalo wings, king crab legs, bbq chicken, ribs, bud light, coors, you name it American and it's there.  A classic.  I love the decor, the red/white checkered table cloths, the dark wood panelling and the ridiculous specials they have everyday of the week. If I lived in the area I would be here regularly (read: daily), if I could cope with being a fatty.  All you need to know is:  America, fuck yeah!

CUuWy6LGK0fCit9Eig0PvQ.text: It is exactly that...Easy!I have been here a few times in the winter and the summer and it is just a great place to go with friends and family, chill out order some yummy food and relax.The food is American but not greasy and fatty. We usually order the BBQ choices of chicken, lamb ribs, coleslaw, and of course lobster!! The lobster is fantastic! Fresh, tasty and a healthy size. The steak is also delicious, cooked just how you like it...rear, medium rear, medium or well done.The decor is simple, relaxed, you feel like you are walking into a ranch, horses tied up outside, cowboy boots on the table and the smell of sizzling meat, random sayings dotted around...'gone fishing'. Just a great place. They also have big screens so you can watch big American sports games.They often have live music on a Friday and Saturday, good beat really setting the scene!

Photo of Big Easy - London, United Kingdom

bqja07QF7BxlCnDBcfV0bw.text: I used to love Big Easy, what's gone wrong??  Went last night and everything started out great...then got our food and were left to fend for ourselves the rest of the night!  Food was ok, perhaps not as good as in the past, but the service was the big let down.  No one checked to see how our meals were, no one bothered to see if wanted to order more drinks (I could barely talk by the end of the meal as i was so parched!) and even trying to pay was a big mission...Good the place is busy, but please sort out the staff to customer ratio!  I always tip for good service, but was less than impressed with the 12% gratuity added to the bill and then to get asked if I wanted to add a tip to the credit card on top of that.  You can only get away with adding service when you're positive it's always great!

iRz9X0ZAJdOgnncN3uvxLg.text: Lobster, shrimp, steak, wings, shaaawing! Excellent. Yeah, that's right, this place is great fun. Live band downstairs boosts the atmosphere. You get American style service, so yeah, you actually get service! Frozen margaritas, cold beers and lots of different deals are always on. Love it. Just make a reservation. Drove from North London one night and couldn't get a seat. I could have waited, but life's too short and there are other fun places in London. So definitely go here, but make a reservation. You'll have an awesome time. Sit downstairs where the band is for added fun. Rock on!

DtP6GodHMNk7IX8GthIXrw.text: Used to work in Chelsea and this place is quite well known for its burgers, lobster and value for money so decided to check it out with a group of us.Wasnt disappointed, it was very busy and has a real buzz inside of everyone looking to enjoy their evening.Service is casual and fits in nicely with the restaurant, food was great and value for money great too.Had a band playing in the downstairs bit when we were there to add to the atmosphere.Overall it was a great place for a few drinks and some food after work.probably wouldnt go for a quiet date though!.

BQNhQI56tM_jNf55pNJifg.text: The Big Easy is great fun, with fabulous cocktails and lovely food. It's better to book a table but you won't be disappointed; tasty and large dishes with friendly staff and a lively atmosphere make this a place you want to keep coming back to.

r1LH33Kt6lEExgU1At7bjw.text: If this was the states, we'd call it TGIFridays and then be done with it.  But it's London and it's novel, so it's the Big Easy.  First, you do not go here for the food. Anything my friends ordered fried was delicious...like the fried shrimp inexplicably covered in hot wing sauce.  Salads - don't even go there.  My friend had some rendition with packaged shredded cheese, canned vegetables and a few artfully placed pieces of lettuce. I had the shrimp fajitas...the tortilla's tasted like Old El Paso, there was nary a mexican spice on it, and guacamole was definitely the kind which comes from a plastic tub made by Kraft. However, with the amount of tequila I consumed, I could care less which brings me to...Second point - you do go here for the Frozen Margheritas.  If only for the glory of watching the ice whirl around in the multiple jugs behind the bar.  It brings me back to my college days when the bar down the street had Margherita Mondays (only $1!).  You can get any flavour (I prefer passion fruit) but ask for salt, not sugar on the rim of the glass.Third, you absolutely, positively go here for the live music.  On a Sunday night, they had a great cover band downstairs playing every top 40 hit from the 80's to today...we found ourselves singing along with Kenny Loggins, Britney, and Robbie Williams.  Cheesy pop sounds better when sung wholeheartedly...with drunken accompaniment.

34ir7nAJvoIzKwLWKa3mkw.text: This place is the best spot for american food in London without a doubt. There is always a nightly special, my favourite is the all you can eat big pig gig, which is all you can eat Ribs and Chicken for £15 inc a beer. This is mondays only but a total steal. Please note you might need a taxi home as the ribs are falling off the bone delicious and walking can be a problem after! Wednesday night is all you can eat fajitas for £15They also have wings, burger and fries plus a beer for £9.95 Mon - Thursday which is excellent. I currently have one of these in my gut from last nightThe interior is exactly what you would expect from a placed call Big Easy! Its cheesy americana but so what. Live music in the basement is an excellent but can be quite loud, if you want peace ask to be seated upstairs. Always book.

mvXCx4Cs5oHYrI9-jJPFSw.text: We went to Big Easy last Sunday (great live music) and were delighted.  The new chef, Kevin (only a few weeks) came out to talk to us when we asked if lobster rolls were on the menu, which was much appreciated.  As for people who say the food wasn't great, I'd urge a return -- we found the food wonderful, no doubt thanks to Kevin's new leadership.  We had the lobster & it was wonderful.This is a fun American restaurant, food quality was excellent.  Worth the trip, especially with the new chef.  My only comments:  they need to add lobster rolls, corn on the cob and beer on tap to the menu.

bISC04-WSVXSO5tTxdifPg.text: Taken me a while to finally visit the Big Easy, and oh how I wish I had been here sooner. I ordered the rib eye steak with grilled shrimp, the 2lb lobster (under the lobster festival) which came with fries, salad and a cold beer or frozen Margherita. We also tried some appetisers, the deep fried shrimps - simply divine! To drink I also ordered a Banana Buddy, a coconut and banana milkshake, just ace. Awesome food, will be back for more... Only downside is the service which was particularly slow, but staff were friendly enough..

iua_wNTI0cuxRJakmYc9zQ.text: Lets keep it simple for this one-GOOD: BBQ restaurant, large portions, inexpensively priced, lots of beers :) Hmm...beer.NOT SO GOOD: bit cramped and the time I went, this band was blasting the hell out of my ears.if youre likely to go with a bunch of mates, then the pros above are probably all you need to hear!!Come hungry, leave full and battered.

xeojjIZZJO4r2Q6RadSU9g.text: This is my second visit and I still give Big Easy a round of applause for keeping it real.Great atmosphere, steaks, drinks, lobster and service. It's noisy but fun, I recommend going with friends for a bit of excitement before you hit the bars!!The entree sharing platter for two is for ten...massive...user beware!!! Excellent value.Sit downstairs there a great little Jazz band playing cheese music!! Great fun!! They have giant churners of cocktail mush.... get into it. I recommend the Pinacolada!!Great place. just go

wImXNZg9LikiYdLVONbE3g.text: Not the sort of restaurant you'd expect on the swankier end of the Kings Road, Chelsea, more of a Deep South kinda place especially inside and downstairs where  we were seated. We enjoyed - grazed on / devoured - the Surf and Turf on Thursday night, 3 of the friends I went with had been a month previously and raved about it so I was expecting good things.....and wasn't disappointed. I'm not too much of a steak fan but loved this especially with the delish blue cheese sauce on top and shock horror was up until this night a lobster virgin and loved this. I also enjoyed the lime margarita that came with the surf and turf deal. We also quickly got through the amazing pork scratchings with apple sauce that our waitress had recommended to us. The service was really friendly and quick (especially as a friend of ours that we thought wasn't turning up, did and although he ordered about 20 minutes after us didn't have to wait too long after our food came out, only about another ten minutes). The only problem we had was that one of my friends and I had ordered friends with our surf and turf and they gave us a jacket potato instead, when we said this, they simply brought out fries too - good customer service! As if we weren't getting fat enough though!! There was also really good live entertainment from a couple singing and playing live music who were excellent.Be warned, you will leave feeling very full and fat so pre-warning make sure you come feeling hungry!! Recommended for a fun night - we can't wait to return for Shrimp Night on a Tuesday! - good service and fab and tasty food!

o7orlU-vCeNzYkADfK6HxA.text: Burger and lobster pftttt. This is the place to go. Make it a Thursday when there is lobster steak chips and salad for £20 oh plus a free beer. Great live music and fantastic service. Enjoy!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Big Easy - London, United Kingdom. Bring a girl. They give u all their steak!!! Mall tuckered out now.

vtgxOyXryTNXhlB4eiLXRg.text: Sometimes I hesitate to give a place like this more than 3 stars.  Feels like I'm falling into a trap where cheap seafood meal deals override quality & service.  I really hope not, but I've been to this location twice, and once to their new location in Covent Garden, and have been pretty happy both times (though, I can't say I recommend the CG location!)The atmosphere is slightly stuffy, and most of the time, the tables are so close to each other that your butt will knock over a few things as you try to squeeze your way out to the restroom. For food that cheap that gets pumped out routinely, I wasn't going to have high expectations.  But man, it was good, and I hope they do have a high rate of consistency, as our party was very happy both times! The first time around, Cheryl & I got the unlimited fried shrimp basket which came with tartar sauce, fries, coleslaw, and a margarita for £17.  I can't say much for the margarita - its a slush and comes out of a machine, and I didn't enjoy it very much, but its the standard drink that comes with most deals.  The deal is so cheap already, I'll happily pay for a different drink or milkshake from the menu. The popcorn shrimp was definitely hot, fresh and crispy! Loved the crunch of the shrimp, and it was so delicious!  Refills give you about 4 pieces, usually without fries unless you want more fries as well. We EACH got a side of mac n cheese (£3-4?).  All the mac n cheese sides I've ordered are usually a tiny dish, and Cheryl & I are pigs, we admit it - we can usually finish our own sides.  But holy cow, for that price, we each were given a large dish of mac! it was tasty, and more than generously sized! We hardly dented our sides, and had to take it home.  Second time, I had the whole 1.5lb lobster (includes fries and marg) for £20.  It was my first whole lobster, and it was cooked really nicely! The flesh was nice and bouncy, not solid & chewy at all! Clarified butter was good, and I did a number on the lobster licked clean every crack and crevice! Definitely great value and tasty for that price! Others were happy with their steak / rib dishes.  Cooked really well, and tender, fall off the bone meat for the ribs.  Also, please be cautious of the amount of food you order! These dishes ARE big, so if you do need an appy or side, order 1 between 2 people (especially if you are here on an unlimited night),  If you usually pack up leftovers, then thats fine - but that comment was mainly directed at those who don't usually bother with leftovers.  I've seen so much food wastage here because some people don't realise how large the dishes are!  Anyway, I've been happy both times, the quality was consistent, and I hope that if I come back here down the line, it'll continually be good!

TWlIAehz7RL73Yl5ITf6FQ.text: I have been going to the Big Easy for over 8 years now and it is still as good as ever! The daily deals are definitely worth checking out - Lobster, Steak, Fajitas, Ribs. Just pick your day! The starter platter WAS superb value once upon a time at £30 for 6 people to share but it is now doubled and not any bigger. Save it for the mains or order individual apps.

RBPdNUwo1LXf4B8wiszLfA.text: I went to Big Easy with a Big Group, and unfortunately, it just didn't work in our favor. I'd like to think this was the result of having an early reservation we struggled to make, a party too big, and a space too small. But it could also have been the food prepared en masse, the lack of friendly service, or the overwhelmingly American atmosphere... And I'm an American saying that.I can see what would make Big Easy charming--they offer a distinctly American experience at a reasonable price, with a huge array of menu options and flavors that just aren't commonly found in the UK. Certainly, I got the impression I was in a crab shack by the atmosphere and sensory overload. Unfortunately, it just didn't come together very well for me and my group, and in a city of so many amazing options, I can't say I'll aim to go back.

YSEA8SlQUI4JH73JoUlflg.text: GREAT PLACE: four stars to this joint, with amazing sea food, juicy meats and a fun, musical atmosphere. I resent the food being called average because I personally found it very high in standard, and FINE, it's not Ferran Adria' but for what it is, namely bbq meats and general "American" food, i thought it was really great. Must try but beware: do not go when on a first date, because you WILL get dirty. See more pics and info at peoplewhoalwayseat.wordp…

GGAxr1rC2MVrmUh5CkLHEQ.text: A very fun and laid back environment. The line can get long so be sure to make reservations ahead of time! The food was good. I would recommend going back again. Reasonable prices for food considering the area it's in. I went on a Friday and was hoping for live music but I guess another time?

Pm50zYdmEsEe3M3IDsdVJg.text: The Big Easy always seems to be PACKED, which really has kept me from trying it out until fairly recently, as I despise being crammed into a small busy bar area, with people bumping into you incessantly.Finally made it by for a happy hour, and one bar table opened up which we magically jumped on.  Even with a table, backpacks (is this normal in the UK?? who goes to a bar or restaurant with a backpack on??? who owns a backpack??) were bumping into us from people standing at the bar, and I felt horribly for the waitress who had to incessantly ask people to excuse her so she could walk through the mobs with food.  Nonetheless, the bartenders were great, and the drinks, albeit sweet and fairly virgin, were cheap.Came by another time in a party of four, and they begrugingly said we could have a table until they needed it later.  Not a problem, that was fine with us.  Luckily this trip was absolutely VACANT, so we spent 5 pm until 11 pm there, unfortunately buying full priced drinks like they were going to run out, and racked up a disturbingly large "happy hour" tab by when we left.All drinks on the front page of the menu, and all frozen margs are two for one, then they'll give you wines two for one if you ask at the bar (not sure about beer).  They also have amazing food specials (all you can eat fajitas on weds, a lobster special one day, pretty much something for each day of the week), albeit each and every weds we forget and miss out.Hopefully soon will actually remember and be able to try the food!  Plus with my boyfriend from NOLA, the name alone is something he's fond of.  Good bloodies as well, albeit a bit mild for my tastes (but you can add more of your own pepper, tabasco, etc).

CPL8KQejYvUgYg7GrTtQyw.text: I love the food at this place. Bar-B-Q Ribs & Shrimp is my dish... always leaves me in a food coma... totally worth it!

5hqWVgeyncfzuAklzCk3yQ.text: This restaurant came highly recommended by a colleague, but I am very surprised that I didn't find this American establishment myself. It has an American flag hanging just inside the door, and country bands that come from the US to play live! With just a glance at the menu, I knew exactly what I wanted: the crab shack combo for some much missed good seafood. I was with a friend that had also lived in the States, and we also ordered the deep fried calamari and a half rack of baby back ribs to cover all the bases. I loved the seafood combo, but have a few suggestions: it would have been better with more prawns (I only saw a few) vs. the mostly mussels selection thrown in there, to pre-crack the two crab claws, halve the potatoes, and it would also be amazing if they had a Southern-style cajun sauce available (you're called the Big Easy, for heavens sake...), even though the garlic white wine sauce was good too! The rib portion was enormous... we easily had 4-5 ribs each, and it comes with coleslaw and beans, so there is plenty to go around. I also liked that the place had Blue Moon, which was one of my favourite beers back in the States, but I found it weird that they did not have any beers or ciders on tap (bottles only). Then around the 9 pm mark, there was live music which seemed to be coming from downstairs, and I bet it would be really cool to come back for a gig. Overall, this was a refreshing bit of Americana in London and a very lively place with some great food!

ax4g1cj_WEr7_qSqNqVVvw.text: This place was something else, the portions are M. A. S. S. I. V. E!!!!!! The chicken was so tender, and the barbecue sauce was great but the ribs were good, not great.  The reason for the -1 star is that it's just way too packed with no room to move. Let's just say if you're going to stuff people with american portions you most give them enough room to pull their chair back an inch... Or two

XY3xxTiRYCgUTj7tU4bZlA.text: Used to come here all the time. Was very good but has gone downhill. 3x I have been and won't go back.1st time- service terrible while there were only 5 occupied tables.Ordered the voodoo wings and then ribs and chicken lunch. Voodoo wings dry and to camouflage that fact covered with the hot sauce, very bad.Ribs were good but chicken dry..2nd time- service better this time went over the weekend so no lunch special.Decided to order the same to see whether previous time was just a one off of dried chicken.Exactly the same!!!! 3rd time- service was good but they forgot an item with every course we ordered!Ordered again the wings to test, again dry! Sent them back and then the manager stated the chef was making a fresh new one. Within 5 minutes I had a new one ( impossible in that time fresh and new) it looked the same portion just more sauce dropped over it to camouflage the dryness. Then they forgot the extra blue cheese sauce which I ordered and was charged 2.75!???Main was the burger... Never get this if you like rare to medium burger as they ONLY do medium well to well. Really dry and on top of that forgot to bring the fries?!!! I mean really with a burger??!!Not sure whether the way they serve their meat is a reflection on how bad it might be that they will only serve it from medium-well upwards.All in all after these 3 attempts have decided that Big easy is off my list, even though the week lunch is a great deal. No deal can compensate for bad food. So bye bye Big Easy.

9-i4nYczggfuOFyEzMKNFQ.text: I went to the Big Easy specifically for the Lobster Special which included a Margarita. I was happy to land a table outside on a gorgeous Friday afternoon. The service was average and the margarita was so-so. The lobster was well cooked but nothing special. If you are looking for a laid back spot with good specials the Big Easy is worth checking out if you are in the area but I wouldn't go out of your way to try it.

fh0cgH6K86VDLUqR3Wc_FA.text: Had the ribs/chicken combo, portion was big enough for me to be full after the main. It was good but probably not up to Bodean's standard. Had some scorpion 'bowl' cocktails which tasted great but came in pitchers and seemed a bit of a rip off. Desserts were delicious but I was cramming it in on top of the main course (my greed's fault not the big easy's).Where it excelled was atmosphere, our waiter was cool and the place was busy but didn't feel like you were right on top of people. The live music from 9 was entertaining without being obtrusive. Really want to go back in the week cause it seems like they have some great all you can eat deals.

y8UF3HhYrP8HW0FSXmWnuw.text: I've been to a few BBQ-style restaurants in the US, so I guess I had high expectations for the Big Easy. Our table of six ordered a mix of starters. The jumbo shrimp were nice and plump but the "tempura" batter was more like pub style fish batter. The accompanying voodoo hot sauce was tasty - similar to the hot sauce you get with buffalo wings. The clam chowder was on the generous size but pretty heavy with all the potato and cream that went into it. The smokey bacon gave it a great flavour but overall left me pretty full before the main course.Our orders of rib and chicken combos were pretty standard. Both meats were probably precooked and reheated before serving. The BBQ sauce that was basted on top was a poor attempt to add flavour and moisten the already dry meat.We were served by a very friendly and accommodating waitress. A live band started playing around 9pm to liven the mood. Overall, I think I'd stick to Bodeans.

TbfgnyF7dUU-60Q7P4_tfw.text: Great lunch menu - £10 for start, main and drink! Huge portions, and good service - what more could you ask for?! Amazing fajitas, buffalo wings, and ribs! I always leave in a food coma :)

YHeoYNSAOd18lxkhCNy2jA.text: The Big Easy is a fun and festive restaurant, with red checkered table cloths and knick knacks on the walls,. it is a cool place to grab a drink with friends and chill out. I saw people with buckets of Corona and I noticed Budweiser on the menu, which is rare for London. For such a place, I was surprised by its extensive wine list. I had the wings, which were pretty good and my brother went with the all you can eat shrimp. He liked them but they were fried in batter and the portion was so huge that the all you can eat factor is a bit of a rip off. I haven't been back, but it seems like a nice place to chill out with some buddies and split some appetizers.

wdBcMlaVOyLNWtxOrEJ-XA.text: I went there with my sister.We had an amazing dinner.A lobster with fries and salad+1 beer/frozen margarita at 20£ each!Cocktails are a bit expensive!

n_-qgipDqajmCrh0Nc-sMg.text: Don't let the name fool you...the Big Easy has nothing to do with New Orleans cuisine. However, it does offer some of the better American style food you can find in Chelsea if not all of London. Although vinyl red and white checkered tablecloths scream TGIFridays....this is actually a fun boisterous environment for a meal and many drinks.The menu is a mixed of grilled bbq ribs, chicken, and assorted meats as well as traditional coastal fare like lobster and crab. And yes they do have actually quite tasty chicken fingers served with honey mustard dipping sauce. I went here for the 4th of July festivities (be sure to book in advance), and they had a special---all you can eat ribs and chicken for about 15 pounds/head....score! On the main menu of the restaurant they have  a margarita bar --- with a wide selection of pre-made slushy style margaritas. We should have gone with the slushies as I asked the bar tender to make a margarita on the rocks and it was vile. It was just tequila (he forgot the lime and triple sec), upon mentioning that my drink was colourless and foul he added a splash of triple-sec. Really? Come on..Big Easy you need to train your bartenders...anyone working behind a margarita bar should know how to make margaritas!?!That said, I was pleased with the BBQ fare and the overall party atmosphere definitely reminded me of the states. Just stick with the pre-made drinks and you'll have a ball.

RPXyEVQIgyrBkHcYbyPMrA.text: Nice place in a posh location. I actually prefer the newer branch in Central London (Covent Garden) but it has good service, good space and good food. Though I found the seating a bit too packed closely for my liking.

JCVbctese5PoZR0dNmC_UA.text: This is my idea of hell. Crammed tables, bibs, nearly everything is fried, bread crumbed and served with cheesy creamy dips. How much fat can you cram into one meal? Ugh.You don't get a plate, but trays of food. Everyone is overeating, and when you reach your fill, there's no escape. The smell of gluttony pervades every corner. Clearly though, I am in the minority on this one. The place was heaving on a Tuesday night, with well groomed Londoners, tying back their hair, to facilitate their binge.

b6ZnUBPHcb8YUdeVTtr7uw.text: I had my reservations about this place because anywhere purporting to do BBQ American style AND seafood really well raises a skeptical eyebrow from me. However, we had a great meal Thursday night. I had the steak fajitas (£16.95), which were generous in portion and tasty. The steak had a nice char to it, but there could have been a bit more of it as the three tortillas only had a little bit each. Lots of onions and peppers, and the guac/salsa on the side were delicious. 7/10. My strawberry margarita was excellent. My husband had the lobster roll (£16.95) which had 1 pound of lobster in it, and came with a side salad and chips. Good portion size, and he devoured it quickly. He rates it 9/10 - no complaints, but he hates giving out perfect scores. He loved the classic margarita as well. Our food was very good, the vibe was fun and casual, and the service was friendly if slow. Dessert looked great, but we were too stuffed.I got a membership card in the mail the next day, too! Nice surprise perk. Would definitely recommend the margaritas and will happily go back to try some BBQ.

Rf_sencc4Gs7l7RR5m-w5g.text: I've been wanting to try Big Easy for a while now and finally went last night. Gotta say, the atmosphere is fantastic. We were seated downstairs and around 7:45/8pm a live, 2-man band started playing some great tunes. My boyfriend and I both had the steak & lobster Thursday deal. What a great value! 1/2 lobster, steak, chips and a margarita for £19.95. Everything was delicious and we were rightfully stuffed after the meal.My only complaint about this place is that they pretty much pack in the tables so there's very little room for the waiters to maneuver about. Everytime someone passed by me, they knocked into my chair which gets annoying after a few times. Other than that, all was good and will definitely be back to try out more of the menu.

o_Qpyz8y50H0-tGcwSK7Qg.text: The place to go for a messy feast of a meal. The restaurant is a casual American crab shack but not sloppy. The place is always packed, the margarita jugs are always flowing, the enormous platters of pulled pork and ribs, or giant lobsters are always passing over your head. The lobsters are nothing special (how many different ways can you cook a lobster?) but it's the challenge of dissecting it whilst still looking decent with a bib over your front. It can be a bit noisy with the live band downstairs, but it is so much fun and time flies. A great evening out with mates in a central location.

photos.caption: Photo of Big Easy - London, United Kingdom. Bar-B-Q Ribs & Shrimp - Full rack of smoked baby back ribs, 3 wild jumbo shrimp cooked in their shells over charcoal grill

3ewbOZOUbf_hJZHuvbyQWw.text: Thursday - Steak and Lobster night - amazing! Delicious steak, lobster, salad, Jacket potato and a frozen Margarita for £20, what more could you ask for?

9T4Q-JFD1RvF55MYN5dxEQ.text: Such good value for money! The lunch menu is amazing value! £10 for a either a frozen Margarita (which were lush) beer or soft drink +  2 courses. I had the mussels to start followed by their jumbo shrimp basket. I couldn't finish it all as the portions were really big and not what I expected at all considering its only £10! The food was really good, I definitely recommend this place for a quick lunch date!

gn3NI0ezR_HS9ChjgK-cjA.text: Love this place.Great food, drinks and atmosphere although sometimes the service can be a bit slow.Perfect for a late Sunday lunch but be prepared to be extremely full afterwards.Also, if you're going to get a sharing platter as a starter the platter for two is plenty for four.

I1CUJyh2rgbQVsSq2RsqHA.text: Great fun atmosphere.  Bartenders are great. Drinks are generous.  Food is good.  Great place to kick back and have some good American food.  The atmosphere is good both upstairs and downstairs.  If seated downstairs - make sure you are close to the live music.  Can become a little tedious if too many people are hosting their birthday parties - enough already.

brL6KkL6Doub9HVwReltdw.text: Avoid. Like the Plague. The owner doesn't want you there anyway.I am not a nitpicker, as my rather generous reviews of other establishments would show. This establishment must have committed some gross error of mistaken identities when they asked my boyfriend and his friend, both of whom were sharing a civilised bottle of champagne to celebrate Chelsea's win that afternoon, to leave. With nary an explanation or reason to support his demand that they leave. Even so, it's a mistake that is somewhat hard to forgive.Not cool, sir, not cool at all.

wmUPT67lBT2KfEtQgTGOQQ.text: By no means the food at Big Easy is anywhere close to outstanding, but for some classic American BBQ in London, this is the place you've got to try, on top of that you also have the lively atmosphere and music which does really make you feel like you are in the US. Well worth a try for meat lovers who like to get their hands dirty. Bare in mind they've also got a site in Covent Garden with a much bigger space and a wider selection of spirits and cocktails.

HKnPsHx25txpHhsnH-5oBg.text: GREAT VALUE FOR MONEY!!!You simply can't beat the price! Lobster, fries, salad and a drink for £14.95!!!!!Can be abit hard to book a table for when you want so advance bookings are always advisable.  Great location, good service, can get abit noisy when they've got a live band playing (you can't hear yourself talk).quick service.definitely worth a visit or 10.

BxqR2gIHtFNwB3ywwrUh4w.text: I've been eating here for about 10 years and love coming back but you need to be hungry! The mid week lunch menu is 2 courses and a drink for £10 and it will fill you up all day! The daily specials are also brilliant - I love the all you can eat ribs (but can never eat that much!). The atmosphere and live music is also great - it's a pretty chilled out place, not too fancy and loads of food for your money

UhnIHhgGPUbOq9V54oi1qQ.text: i finally made the lobster and steak night on a thursday. For £19.95 you get a lobster, steak chips and any margarita or beer, - i can safely say this was great value,I booked online and i could only get 2 early sittings as its a very popular night, so book in advance or you might be disappointed if you just turn up.Each night has a different menu special from pig gig to  unlimited fajitas as well as a pre 5pm special burger wings and beer for £10I will be going back for my lobster duo

p2aQiwAOKpYz2g1d_X7rqw.text: The lobster is too die for. I preferred baked potato over fries. They don't know what a medium steak is they would give you a well done so you'd rather ask for a medium rare. Go on Thursday and get the lobster fest deal. It's really loud downstairs and you can't really talk. Cocktails are good.

photos.caption: Photo of Big Easy - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Big Easy - London, United Kingdom

ozb3li5KKOsNnFgVVnfLcA.text: 4 for the overall experience.Big easy is noisy, it's crowded, the food is average but there's something very comforting about it. It could be the dim lighting or the friendly staff or just the smell of BBQ. I've been there with big groups, small groups and just by myself and it's always nice experience. Like yesterday, I was having a bad day and I just wanted to wallow in a bowl of messy saucy wings. So I went to Big Easy and did just that. The place was packed, so I stood by the bar and devoured my wings quietly. The bartender was very nice and attentive. He didn't judge my caveman style eating at the bar, instead he brought me a bunch of wet wipes with a smile. Anyway so I went home feeling satiated and slightly drunk (yes I always chugged 2 glasses of wine caveman-style with the wings).There's no bad day a bowl of wings and a glass of wine (or 2) can't fix!

Q4bXDeOWKhVbuntugwGz4w.text: My GF and I had been looking forward to this place for a while and wanted to try out the lobster and something a little different hence choosing this place.We booked in for Sunday and arrived about 10 minutes early, was told to wait at the bar whilst they sorted the table. I was driving so had a coke and she fancied a chocolate milkshake, although really busy the barman came over pretty quick, we ordered and was told they had just run out of chocolate ice cream!?? so we both opt'd for Coke. Now I know what Coke tastes like and I have no idea what this was, it was a combination of flat KFC Pepsi or some random no name brand cola but hey ho it's only a drink.After about a 5 minute wait we were shown to our table which was already empty as I noticed it when I walked in so I assume the bar trip was to get us to buy drinks, cutlery wise the table had only a knife on each on there as people were taking forks from other tables due to the person that brings the food out forgetting to bring the forks (I think they have dedicated waiters and food servers)To start we had the Lobster Cocktails which were really nice, we then asked for the 1 1/4 Lobster but was informed that they had run out so she had the ribs and I had the burger (that did not include fries), the ribs were nice however the burger was grim. It was just bland and chewy and the bread just dried it all out and it had that cooked at the same time as the starters and left under the lights warmth to it. The fries (£3.60) were just over salted over cooked fries and the coleslaw was just coleslaw.The bill for 3 so called Cokes (not inc bar drinks) and food came to £58 which included the 12% tip in there so you have no option but to just pay this, don't get me wrong I do pay tips where warranted but to have it forced upon you is just wrong!The place was in a good location, the decor was good and don't get me wrong it must be popular as the days we wanted to go were fully booked and it was full when we arrived but on this occasion the food didn't pop or wow us, it was just food.Would I try it again, maybe as I think it could be nice if the right item was chosen.

HBvTuiju_O9DE3sa8_3qww.text: American crabshack bar, the BBQ rib is so tender and amazing , shrimps are tasty, the plate is like 3 times of my head's size, with live music court, but not on show when I was there, little bit of space-narrow when sitting around the tables, but worth a 4 stars forsho !

photos.caption: Photo of Big Easy - London, United Kingdom. BBQ rib and shrimps meal!

uZmoHG2aDIREn0JmvFMlWA.text: As an American, I was craving some good bbq ribs, so we tried this place for dinner. Hubby and I both had ribs, he has the full rack Kansas style ones and I had the baby rack ribs. Both came with beans (great) and coleslaw (tasteless and gross). We preferred the regular ribs to his Kansas ribs and loved the sauce. The cornbread muffin as a side was good, too. The two ladies at the check in area were very sweet and helpful! Our server was great too, until he gave me the credit card machine and circled with his finger where it asked if I wanted to leave a tip! I thought that was unnecessary as I can read, and with the service charge already included on top of his action, I didn't give an extra tip. Would suggest he not be so forward next time as it is awkward and not necessary.I would recommend this place to others looking for good bbq baby back ribs!

PPQ0YETHAAuGMbp5XNBN8A.text: This place was big, but the service was far from easy. The only thing that went down well was my pickle "jack" shot, after I waited 20+ min for the first one. Or ribs were nice and smoked, with more than just char, if you like dry ribs and conversation with your server, this is place to come. Decent drinks, slutty service.

Eb7Xjv_HG-nzGludAQq2iQ.text: Second time at the Kings Road branch. Massive amount of people. Be sure to book your seats before coming!Had the grand appetiser which was starters for two. Absolutely huge and tasty too. For mains, we had lobster bake and the lobster mac and cheese. My lobster bake was really worth the price. At £26, you will get a half lobster with its pincer, crab pincer, a huge prawn and mussels! As for the mac and cheese, I didn't like the chunky fries that came with it. Mac and cheese was done well though! Tip: do not order the root beer shake. It was disappointing when I saw my drink. Looked nothing like the root beer floats I used to have.

WBm7w4CS2q814Qx3lCZ95w.text: I do not like sea food but this place is extremely good. Lobsters, crab claws, prawns are absolutely delicious. Local beer is a simple lager but it is very good and quite cheap. I like it andI will come back here as soon as I can.

05EbZLi2IzS4AKbJNjLc_Q.text: YOU MUST GO HERE. I came with my boyfriend on a Thursday night when they had a deal - 25 pounds for steak, lobster, a drink (either prosecco or a blended cocktail), and fries. DELICIOUS!!! I had dreams about this place and that meal for days after, and wanted to go back for more. Unfortunately, we weren't able to fit in into our itinerary.I HIGHLY recommend this place. We were able to walk in at about 9:30 without reservations, but I recommend you make them because it was BUSY!

6OxP8ad79B0ZbV__WvATPQ.text: How oh How have I left this review for so long?I'll blame it on Donald trump! He seems to be the cause of all problems lately so hey ...Ok so I've been to big easy an untold amount of times and way before they opened their canary wharf and Covent garden branch! The portions are huge! Flavour town supreme from the moment you walk in and best of all they are so reasonably priced its not right! They have a lunch time menu which is just £10 and you get a starter,main course and a frozen margarita/beer or wine... Lord give me strength that's a bargain baby!Downside is that its got that old western theme which makes the interior a little dark and hot (not hot in rihanna hot but hot in there are one too many shady people in this lift with me so I need to get out hot) .... Other than that yup love love love! Loads of seafood to feast on and it tastes super fresh!! OMG those prawns are killer!! *passes out from pure pleasure*

H-4qRbRM6RwfSNlYLi3FUw.text: I must say enjoyed the food, but what ticked me off was the terrible service. My waiter did not check to see how we were getting along, if we needed drink. I we have money wtf. If u don't know how to interact with people and make them feel good, than get a damn new job. I tip well when I am treated well. The owner needs to do something about this. I don't recommend this place.

w6z1jOChlpMimhAs6jRqzQ.text: Quick glance:+ daily special deals+ happy hour until 7pm+ pitcher of cocktail+ takes reservation- jam packed seatingFull review:A group of five of us visited on a Thursday night. Although we have pre-booked, we were (craftily) directed to wait at the bar. There really isn't much room in the venue, so we tucked ourselves against the bar, absent mindedly dancing around other patrons and the staff, to order and recieve our cocktails before being seated downstairs. Happy hour goes on till 7pm though, which is a plus. The venue is sizeable, partly because they have stacked the tables and chairs very close to each other so that once you are seated, you feel cacooned by the decor and other diners. There was a band literally sat on top of another set of diners; on the evening we visited, the sound system wasn't working so the live band couldn't play. In some way we were a little glad that we weren't deafened at the "front row" to the small stage. The food is great and portion size incredible - a piece of Americana in Chealsea. Being from the states, I have had my fair share of incredulous steak and ribs and BBQ food, but this comes pretty close, if not on taste than certainly on portion size. The two of us had the sharing platter - ribs, chicken, coleslaw, beans, cornbread muffin and fries. More than enough food to feed a small family!

YAC_aUyi_YI84R-b-nTSkw.text: After reading the reviews we (self, wife, 3 y/o) decided on Big Easy for dinner. I'm conflicted because we left a bit upset. We were seated quite rapidly but away from most diners in a corner. The server was initially polite and chatted with us for a bit and took our order--fajitas, steak sandwich, and a kids bbq ribs. The food was good, but the poor service was what left the lasting impression. We felt neglected and it appeared that other tables were being well tended to. I had to get up and flag someone down a few times during our meal because our initial server disappeared after taking our order, and only reappeared as we were leaving. Definitely not a good overall experience.

tcg043zBEB_jOzDzbyKbKQ.text: Small and difficult, not big and easy. If you are a Brit looking for a slice of Americana with a lot of noise then you will likely like this place a lot. If you have spent much time living or working in the South or the Midwest then you'll find this place cramped, with pretty poor service and a bit run down.Don't get me wrong, the staff are actually pretty good for London but they are sorely lacking compared to the service in even the average US diner. Hard to get the attention of the wait staff. All of them really rushed, don't really have the time to engage with you--let alone give you a big smile and welcome you. Difficult to have them check a bag (they actually don't have anywhere). In fact every surface in the room is actually eating or walking, it is really a tight fit in there. Our table was really cramped, barely enough room to get everyone seated and I felt as though I was constantly being brushed up against by the wait staff, our chairs were right up against the gangway. There was a loose floorboard under my chair so that every time someone went past my chair jiggled up and down. The food and drinks are mostly good and the drinks are authentic enough. I'd give them 3.5 stars there maybe as many as 4 for the lobster.The kids had ribs and wolfed them down--didn't even get to try them. Son the younger didn't like his mac and cheese. I didn't like the side of it that we ordered either. You get a timed booking and then two hours for your slot. I'm not sure what happens after that time but I suspect it would be neither big nor easy. I feel bad comparing this to an American diner but there you have it. We travelled quite a way across London to get our US fix (we used to live there) and Big Easy was a bit of a let down. There is no way we would bother taking a special group all the way over there again. The experience just isn't that great. But if you are in the area and fancy some good ribs or lobster, and like a hustly atmosphere, then you'll probably like it far more than I did.Sorry Big Easy!

z4k6EyCnfSz0ZA_0vifyWA.text: I came here last night with the lads to celebrate one of my friends birthday. I was glad to find out that the group organised a group booking for Big Easy as I had heard about the place and I wanted to visit the place for myself. Their was 9 of us in total for a group booking for 17:00 at the kings road Big Easy. Each person in our group had their preferences for what they wanted to as some came with large appetites. I know I was hungry a whole day before our booking for this food! The food options was a little bit confusing at first as we had to choose from the set menu which was an option out of 3 which were the BBQ blow out at £25pp, the surf & turf at £30 person and finally the seafood deluxe at £35pp. The set menu has a variety of starters and mains including a selection of desserts at an additional £5.50. At first I initially thought this place was on the pricey side as I believe you get to choose one starter and main from the selection but I was well and truly wrong, you get everything I mean you get a range of starters and mains like a kings banquet being served out on huge silver trays. The disappointing thing was I couldn't get my seafood deluxe order as their needed to be a minimum of 2 people ordering any of the set menu and as there was 9 of us the maths didn't add up to my expense. However, I had the chance to Oder from the regular menu which now seemed more pricey especially once you witnessed the size of the platter that came out for the set menus. I was actually lucky enough to try everyone else's starter as their was more than enough to go around meaning that I only had to purchase just a main course. Now after we went through mussels with shrimp in a white wine sauce and a course of buffalo wings, Nacho crisps with dips and a delicious tasting garlic bread I think we all knew desserts were out of the window. In fact I was a little worried I would finish my sirloin steak with deep fried battered shrimp and creamy mashed potatoes, but nevertheless we all pursue to finish of our food and to be honest I was the only one that did. I just didn't understand why my mashed looked like vanilla ice cream?  The hospitality and service were really good as our waiter and host made us all to feel welcomed so much so we all remembered their names, crystal, Tim and halo we can only say thanks for a great evening to remember. So would I go back again, yes. It's a great spot to go after work, with your partner, family and friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Big Easy - London, United Kingdom. 400gms of medium rare sirloin steak with battered shrimp and creamy mash that looks like ice cream. #surf&turf #bigeasy
Photo of Big Easy - London, United Kingdom. So much mussels with grilled shrimp for two people share as a starter. #bigeasy
Photo of Big Easy - London, United Kingdom. Garlic bread, jalapeno breadcrumbs sticks, buffalo wings and celery sticks. This was meant to be a starter for two? #bigeasy

nIrqYHq0oNXkIzDpsqIqMg.text: Food is great.. But we struggled with service on a Friday! One hour wait for the food was ridiculous.Also when asked for spare plates - we got 4 when there were 5 of us! Also not enough utensils to eat the lobsters with!Shitty service till no end!

Do_IA3EgUBTLhOAXiR6hOQ.text: Look, it's your best American fix you can get in Chelsea- lunchtime deals where you get your beers, burgers, and chicken wings all for about £15 a head- you're on to a winner. The A la carte menu doesn't dissapoint- long and comprehensive, there's something for everyone- steaks, burgers, seafood, incredible lobster, salads and my favourite, racks of ribs. You're guaranteed to walk away feeling full and satisfied, and like you've enjoyed a little snippet of American cuisine and hospitality. Word from the wise, this place is packed- try and go at lunch, and probably best to avoid on a Friday or Saturday night- because it's one of Chelsea's worst kept secrets.

7wszWq6p8tvXHuBvWua6ow.text: The best place for American Food outside the US I have been so far! Burger and Steaks are awesome and the fries legendary! Very good selection of beer! Also the lobster looked delicious but did not try it yet.There was very good live music and service was fast! This was my second time here and I will definitely be back on my next trip to London!You should make a reservation in advance, the place is really packed!
