IlVw4G3rcQw_Sppk7ahlGw.text: Big Easy was a big disappoint...!  I wanted to love this place.  I really did.  I've ran by this neighborhood spot for almost a year now, and just never made it in.  Well, I finally did.  And I'm sad.  I got their lobster mac & cheese.  Mac & cheese was good, not excellent, but just good.  The lobster - HORRIBLE!  Chewy and flavourless!  I LOVE lobster, and was so disappointed.  All I wanted was a nice juicy, buttery decadent lobster...and I didn't get that!  Their service was great, atmosphere is fun.  They even had live music.  But for a place that is supossed to be known for their lobster, pretty disapointed!

wlGJXTKNuQvp4J4X2WBvdQ.text: My lobster was good and so was my beer, but the salad and chips that came with it were almost inedible, the first being bland and somehow still over seasoned and latter being fried in the same oil they've had since Monday probably, they tasted worse that what I'd get at a chicken shop. The rest of the table ordered different things, and I was told the chicken fajita was quite bland too. Service was really friend tho and though I wouldn't come here often I think it's a funky place to eat meat/lobsters once in a while

IWuP4toOomft9HNgpSkA9g.text: I have been eating here for at least 5/6 years and managed to squeeze a long overdue trip back.It's a shame because big easy really felt like a  moms and pops place but now feels like a chain.The food is very average and the quality has dropped.The steak pretty tastey but very fatty. The shrimp cocktail was awfully dry.The same for there crab claws.Even the onions rings where bad! Dry cold and tasted refried.Also nearly £8 for a small frozen margarita and not even premium alcohol - dead The staff are amazing but the food and the price isn't....Oh and stop serving food on boards with paper sheets. it sticks to the steak/ food and is very unpleasant. Another thing to cut corners I'm guessing....Sorry big easy but you need to concentrate on the quality not quantity.

SkqliapFAdHUPMPYboX6yg.text: Been going to Big Easy since the OLD Chicago Rib Shack closed almost 20 years ago. What a lovely place, a corner of the old USA, in the middle of London. I usually eat baby back ribs accompanied by 2 massive prawns (turf & surf) as the Americans call it. It's delicious with a good helping of coleslaw on the side.To my delight they now have also a selection of lobsters up to 6lb for a very reasonable price and the menu is full of good American food. Seating upstairs is better as is less noisy than downstairs when the band plays. Almost every day of the week they have a eat as much as you can. Each day a different dish. The service is usually friendly and somehow fast. However they change their staff often. The two barmen are very friendly and capable to serve you a selections of drinks and cocktails and happy hour is everyday except Sunday. All in all the place is great the food is great and the atmosphere too.

5e3kWpAsxSHcencmOnTnIg.text: This place reminded me of some of the divey bars in American, with its hanging lights and well, divey decor. And who can resist specials? The daily special here is a decent deal: £20 Lobster + Margarita + Fries + SaladYou get about a pound of steamed lobster, served with lemon and butter.  The fries and the salad are nothing to be excited about but I guess most people take up this offer for the marg and lobster.There was also another special on this night, £19 all you can eat ribs and bbq which sounded tempting but I'll leave this for a more gluttonous night.

LOI_av8qWdwaJ43XnCtxEw.text: I was told about this place by my cousin so I thought I'd go check it out, was worth the trip, the frozen margarita's were delicious and the ribs were really nice, the meat just fell off of the bones, the Monday special of BBQ ribs is a great offer, 'd definitely come back here and I do recommend this place, only downfall is the table space, the tables are really close to eachother and there is hardly any room to get out of your seat without bumping into another customer.

photos.caption: Photo of Big Easy - London, United Kingdom. Monday BBQ Buffet Special (All You Can Eat Ribs)
Photo of Big Easy - London, United Kingdom. Frozen Margarita's

YO1swPwejE9xhaT4mpkFmQ.text: One of my favourites.  Not the wisest venue for a strict veggie as the menu is generally geared around lots of meat and seafood.  Me?  I'm a ribs man and freely admit that I need a bib.  I prefer the regular ribs over the "Big Easy Cut" ribs, personally as the more expensive ones don't have enough bone to gnaw on. The chicken tenders are also delicious as a starter as are the Stuffed Jalapeño Peppers.  BBQ chicken is also rewarding and mixing ribs and chicken is probably the way forward.  It's easy to get very stuffed in here and that is a bit of an issue because it is very, very cramped.  They really pack 'em in!  They'll also want the table back after 2 hours so they can ferry more hungry punters in, so bear that in mind - this is a not a lazy, relaxing joint, but a fast paced, mouth stuffing frenzy of protein, carbs, beer and cocktails.  Just don't go for the music - chances are you won't be able to see the band on their tiny stage, and even if you can it doesn't look especially good or sound especially great, so it's all about the food for me.  Service is generally good, but not award winning by any measure.  Recommended.

IHW1Nvoq-b_PCnjiSHwMJg.text: Went with a group of 12 on a weekday night and was very satisfied. The place is lively, the food is plentful and the drinks come quickly. The staff were also quick to find us extra chairs and then an extra table for our booked table of eight despite being full. This is not high cuisine (apologies America) but if you like burgers, steaks, lobster (bibs provided) and places that buzz with loud happy people then you should bring your friends here.

kESMGkQiujd_yHgY573Vyw.text: food here is nothing to get excited about. i ordered the st louis ribs which were dry, tough and lacked flavor. prices were high considering the poor quality in food. service was fine, but other than that this is just a very mediocre place. i'd spend my money elsewhere.

ewTttG2lxqVloxQyzCd6qQ.text: One of my favorite places to eat in London. Good food and good value for money with their daily specials. Highly recommended.

yRRaWmUubPUHyfeVmBeCGQ.text: If you like American style dining, then this is Fantastic food! Go for the massive sea-food heavy platter to share - highly recommended.

JMnfZ4foqTzJzZAMTamiJA.text: This is a American/Cajun themed low key eating joint that sadly resembles a Chilis on the inside, but is pretty fun and cheap and can be good for dinners if you just want a burger or some crab and crawfish. Not outstanding food, but perfect if you want a low key American meal.

p0I2m-7GLHJRxq5RMI6FxQ.text: The Big Easy is one of those places that seems to have graced London's King's Road forever. I've played swapatop here and spilled barbecue sauce down my front and slurped on far too many frozen margaritas, not necessarily all at the same time. Recently it was my task to book somewhere fun for a reunion of pals, so we went to the Big Easy. I have to say that the margaritas were great while I was waiting (2 4 1 happy hour) but because all my friends were late (shame on them) we ended up being hurried along once too often during the evening because of the restaurant's 2 hour table turnaround policy. Because of this stupid (!) policy they nearly lost out on our dessert custom and I will definitely not be going back in a hurry unless it's on a Monday night when the staff are likely to be less pushed to move people on. The wine was average (shoulda stuck to the margaritas)and the food was served in generous portions, as always, but it just didn't taste as great as I remembered it. The onion rings were a bit more Burger King than Big Easy although the stuffed jalapeno peppers were still pretty good, but the deep fried jumpo prawns tasted as if they'd been sitting around for a while and refried at the last minute.I went for the Crabshack Combo as my main and although the mussels, prawns and claws were good, the potatoes were diappointingly mediocre and the garlic white wine sauce seemed to lack any indication that its two main ingredients - garlic and white wine - had been in any way involved in its creation. Somehow managed to squeeze in some cheesecake, but because the waitress couldn't decide if we could keep our table a little bit longer or not, we almost missed out on dessert altogether and when we were permitted to proceed with ordering the last part of our meal, we were told to eat up in 15 minutes, so I'm afraid that ruined it for me. We liked the margaritas, the atmosphere, the live music and the stuffed jalapenos. We didn't like the booking system, being rushed through our meal or the refried deep fried taste of some of the food. Come on, Big Easy, you can do better! I give you 3 stars for nostalgia's sake and the hope that you can get back to the standards you used to uphold.

zl0RSuidRzt-S9ZFi8PZ7Q.text: a cheap lunch. Fries and burgers and ribs so don't expect anything too classy. It's not quite the full on grill quality of food that I'd have loved to have seen but if you're in a USA junk food mood it will just about do.

sOop4hgJ0z3g1xGYufTSFA.text: Sorry Big Easy but I was not impressed. While there was a certain kitsch value to the decor and the bibs that you are given to wear like something out of a hollywood movie, the food is not great for the Chelsea style pricing. Portion sizes are just ridiculously huge and really just seem to encourage gluttony and quantity over quality.

Uur1_ZhiLtQAmDo_8qPWmg.text: The big easy is great for a group, but pretty awful for a couple. I have found that when with a few people, sat downstairs, sharing platters and listing to live music, it is a great fun evening. I have also been there with my girlfriend and it turns into an irritable, noisy, food fest of not great value. Better steak is available elsewhere.

ntWOi2bmwLYvYgjQvD8Aew.text: I've never had a bad night or regretted going to the Big Easy. It's traditional American fare, it has a shack style wooden interior with rustic charm, and a wide ranging menu with great fish (lobster, crab etc.), meat (steak, burgers) and fajitas. Might be a bit of a struggle for vegetarians, but the atmosphere is wonderful, with live music every evening which is downstairs, and good service and cocktails. They also do a regular happy hour, which is worth calling ahead to double check the times. Also, would recommend booking as it's often difficult to get tables, especially for big groups, on the night. Has a small bar upstairs which is good for waiting though!

GN6irBS7t0uZzOoIKnaBzw.text: My partner always orders the King Crab claws and I usually opt for something steaky, fishy or fajitas. We love it here and go regularly. Service can be frustrating when the food doesn't all arrive at the same time.

irl0c6mAP5mFPZj2dZX-lg.text: The Big Easy is a real American Diner experience. The staff are friendly, the portions enormous and there is live music every night of the week. The homemade coleslaw is the best I have ever tried and the burgers are stacked high. Meat lovers can feast on racks-of-ribs, delicious whole or half chickens and all manner of surf-and-turf dishes. The portions are not for the faint hearted! Be sure to book ahead as the restaurant is unsurprisingly popular- for the best seats in the house ask to sit downstairs with the band.

0R8Xdc9i_2rTn1Z-bW09iw.text: This place is something of an anomaly, and I'm not really sure what it's trying to be  a self-proclaimed BBQ and Crab Shack that's also won a Wine Spectator award! Now, I love BBQ and seafood and wine, but I'm not sure I can recall the last time I had all three at the same place! Oh yeah, and they're known for their tasty margaritas too! Weird Anyway, we started with a couple of margaritas  clementine & ginger for Meg, passion fruit & chile for me. Mine was painfully sweet, and hers was OK, but we generally like to taste our booze instead of being tricked into drinking it, so these weren't really a huge hit with either of us. We opted for bottles of Dos Equis to go with our meals. The menu is huge  there must have been 75 items on it. The best way I can describe this restaurant (and everything about it) is that it's Dock's (a well-known seafood mini-chain in NYC) meets Brother Jimmy's (another NYC mini-chain which has the same motto as the Big Easy, put a little South in your mouth). The décor definitely swung the way of Brother Jimmy's  Christmas lights, US license plates, plank walls, etc. I think the desired effect is to make you feel like you're in a Cajun crab shack (albeit one that serves BBQ and huge steaks and Alsatian wines), but it felt a bit contrived to me. An added bonus  this place played great music. During the first part of our meal, they were piping in southern rock: CCR, the Black Crowes (!!!) and a little Tom Petty for good measure. Later in the evening, a cover band started playing upstairs; they were pretty good, and were definitely playing crowd favorites like Oasis, Jack Johnson, U2, the Foo Fighters, etc. The place is clearly catering to American expats looking for a bit of home. We started our meal with the Voodoo chicken wings. I was hoping for Buffalo-style (these weren't), but these did not disappoint. Fairly spicy and a homemade bleu cheese dressing on the side. The chicken was breaded though, and that didn't go over great with either of us. Overall, they were pretty delicious. After we polished off our order of 5 wings, the waiter brought over hot towels  a nice touch, especially considering that we were both covered in wing sauce. For our entrees, we decided that we would order baby back ribs and a half of a roasted chicken and share. Big mistake. The portions were HUGE, and I suspect that we were fed some genetically modified, mutant (though delicious) chicken. Meg thought the ribs were good, but I thought they were a bit overcooked. Both featured the same BBQ sauce, which was pretty good, but a little sweet for my liking. On the side of both plates (really platters) were huge portions of coleslaw and BBQ baked beans. The coleslaw was just OK, but the beans were great, if for no other reason than they weren't of the ubiquitous Heinz canned variety. Everything made for delicious leftovers on Wednesday night! Total damage: £66. We don't think that we would hurry to come back here, but it could be a fun place to catch a baseball or football game (they have NASN too!) and hang with some expats.

JkAvjimf2stZ2dJVJLxHdg.text: We got here early while waiting for our 3rd (points down to Suzanne) and tried the margaritas because I can never resist one.  They were the premade frozen ones in the machines which I never really seem to be able to recommend because they end up tasting like too much mix, and not enough tequila.  Case-in-point: the Big Easy.  But weak margs aside, the menu was pretty big and spans a big price range.  It looked like it'd be easy to spend your whole paycheck there or take advantage of one of the specials that seemed to offer a fair amount for not that much cost.  The decor was fairly similar to typical American-chains of the same flavor and I think if it was a hair cheaper, I would be drawn to go back sooner.  I remember that they only had clam chowder and our friend Sarah was a bit upset there was no gumbo or something else that would be fitting to a "big easy" restaurant.  Good food though, you won't leave hungry!

Pla8T9atOvX6npBbdYubSw.text: Best Alaskan King Crab in London, have not had anything else but friends say the ribs were a little dry so maybe stick to the crustaceans! Cheesy decor but it's on the whole, quite fun.

0zJxoL1HdHnvaq1GNtSxLw.text: I went to the Big Easy on a Monday night around 7:30pm and it was very busy. The hostess informed our party of 3 that it would be a 45 minute wait which was fine. After waiting outside for about 30 minutes, a table opened up outside and we sat down. We were asked if we wanted to stay outside and we decided we would. About 5 minutes later, it started raining so we went back inside to ask if we can have our name reinstated as we were going to get soaked outside. She said that she could only add our name to the bottom of the list which would mean another 30 minute wait. She said that if we have already been seated, we aren't able to get any priority over anyone else. Even though we hadn't been served or had time to even place our orders outside, as far as she was concerned, we were committed to that table even if it meant getting soaked in the rain. The hostess's attitude was appalling and she had no interest in helping us have a better experience at the restaurant. After waiting another 15 minutes, we left and had a wonderful meal next door at Maroush which I highly recommend!

ONNWlWIGHH1jacMojy8YOA.text: We were a family of 4 hoping to have a quick meal in the late afternoon on a Monday; we were nicely dressed, clean and well-mannered but we were received with such disdain by the greet staff, you would have thought we were street rats from a Dickens novel.  We have never gotten up and walked out of a restaurant before even ordering, but we did at this place.  At 4pm on Monday afternoon - the place was 75% EMPTY.  "Did we have reservations?!!  Sorry, we did not.  Well, there was a table but we had to vacate it by 5:30.  No problem, we said.  Wow, with that intro, we sure didn't feel welcome, but we knew we were not at Taillevent or some similar venue so we overlooked their remarks and attitude and still wanted to eat there...  We were taken downstairs to the second smallest table for 4 near a serving/bussing-station. We accepted graciously and sat down.  We were seated less than one minute when the hostess came back and told us it was a mistake, this table was reserved (mind you, the room is 3/4 empty!). Then she showed us to THE smallest table which was impossibly wedged into a corner protruding into the bussing-station.  There was no way 4 people could sit at table without blocking the wait/bus staff.  The sad thing is that we live in the neighborhood and IF we had had even a semi-ok experience, we could easily have become repeat, if not regular  clients.  But obviously, the Big Easy doesn't value their clientele and they made it clear they didn't need or want our business.  We know we have the choice of where we spend our money, more and more it is our policy not to frequent restaurants who take pains to make customers feel unwelcome or "lucky" to be admitted!

nWz4GCpUp3YpueqPhoX9Aw.text: really good steaks here! they normally do lobster or steak deals that are such good value! The atmosphere is buzzing, it sounds like they have a live band playing (not actually sure but they might have!). Cocktails are good too, defo worth a visit!

7Go0QAS6k6Ypro_Av48FwQ.text: Very Disappointed.  I decided to take my Fiancé for Steak and Lobster for her birthday and had booked a table for 8pm. We arrived early and waited a few minutes to be seated. We decided to Order some Oysters and Voodoo Chicken for starters and ordered the Special Offer of Steak and Lobster. The restaurant was very busy so we were happy waiting a while for our starters. After 40 minutes we noticed that something was wrong as everyone who was seated after us had already received their food and we were still waiting. I asked a waitress if she could check where our food was and after 5 minutes was told that the order had gone missing ( Later we were told that a new waitress had taken our food to the wrong table ) and that they would try and rush the order through again. After another 15 minutes our starters came although the Voodoo Chicken had turned into Voodoo Shrimp that had to be sent back and we waited for the Chicken. Finally we had the starters and as we were finishing the main meals were served. The food was nice as I had expected. We looked at the desert menu and decided to be really brave and try and order The Melted Chocolate Pudding but were advised that they did not have any so I asked for the bill. Although they had not added service to our bill I did send it back and the waitress removed our drinks (Aprox 10% of the bill). I don't usually complain but on this occasion I really thought they only deserved to get 10% not 90% of the bill. I must stress that I have been to The Big Easy on numerous occasions and have never had any issues before. I had previously mentioned to my friends & family how amazing the food and service was there. Possibly the issues on the night were due to new staff but I still believe that even after speaking with the manager they could have dealt with the situation better. As it was my fiancé's first time there and the last experience I would expect it to be a while for us to return.

IoYoCXLARak_x7MkbXnfxQ.text: I'm choosing 2 stars because of the rating description - "Meh.  I've experienced better."I ate at Big Easy with a group of 7 people on a Tuesday night.  The place was crowded with big groups all around.  We were sat downstairs which was most unfortunate because you are not able to hear anyone at your table with the live music.  I found the decor to be cheesyA friend and I ordered margaritas while waiting for the rest of our group to get there.  The margs took ages to arrive and were not good.  Pretty sure mine had close to no alcohol in it!The dinner was average.  No one complained about their meal but no one raved about it either.  Being American, I didn't particularly feel that the food was what I would get back home eitherOverall, I wouldn't plan another dinner here but if someone else were to plan a dinner and invite me- it wouldn't be the worst thing in the world.  I'd definitely request a table upstairs though!

fYPRQhmflLshWCP5og9kPA.text: Just came back from the Big Easy and I am in a word - confused. The service was friendly, the decor great, there was a live band that were actually awesome and I had a megadeal which got me hot wings, chips, 'slaw, a burger and a frozen margarita for a tenner - amazing. However there was something a little off. For a place full of rich, beautiful people it was surprisingly laid-back, but the meals were slow to arrive, the food a little sloppy (apart from my friend's all-you-can-eat-shrimp which was tender and flavoursome) and some of the food was a bit cold. I think my grumbling is a bit mean as it was a pretty fun night I just wish the burgers had been a bit more awesome. Will almost certainly head back nonetheless

sH3IaXrGNQkWvdThYjVBSQ.text: I had been recommended Big Easy by my boss, and i finally reached there last sunday after walking down Kings Road (for what seemed like an eternity) from Sloane Square station.My first impression was ... its a typical american place. With its neon lit signs and and its menu options and interior decorations, i feel they did well in creating the american illusion.But i wasn't here for having pancakes ... i was recommended the "british" steak ... and thats what i ordered ... a well done New York sirloin with french fries and bearnaise sauce. The steak was very tasty ... and not too expensive for its size ... under £20. The great thing was that the size of the steak was mentioned in grams and not in ounces ... and so for once i had some idea about how much i was about to eat :)I had ordered a long island iced tea. It was good but not very strong ... but that was ok for a lunchtime drink i guess. At £7.45, it was a bit of a disappointment though. There are a number of 2 for 1 options if you order at the bar.The menu had a number of seafood options and it seems big easy is known for its lobsters. I am not a great fan of them in restaurants as i find them difficult to handle with cutlery ... but i am tempted to go back here just for the lobsters.The service was again american. The person serving me bothered to talk to me and have a chat ... something i associate with NYC and not at all with London.Overall i thought it was worth it for me to come all the way to chelsea this time just for having the steak outside in glorious sunshine :)

TCiG0oqqTAjfwX1fPLRmJA.text: For a fun lunch of night out, Big Easy can't be beat, but do watch the prices.  I go for the specials, which are great value and, at lunch, the lunch menu which is only £7.99 and gives you two Texas sized dishes.

Duwza3JtKkMnyJjv46qYHQ.text: I adore Big Easy but it never feels right to me without being there in a large group with at least several wannabe lumberjacks who can clear a seriously big plate. You'll almost certainly have to book ahead on any given night. For a whole night out it has a bar, you can watch sport on big screens, the food is tremendous, and they host live music (usually bluesy tunes) downstairs every night from about 8.30/9ish. If you're planning to go here, have a light meal about 6 hours before going to, so that you can build up an appetite for the kind of portions that make you feel they source fresh seafood and meat from Jurassic Park. It's not just the size though, this place delivers quality too. Of course, being on the Kings Road, this doesn't really come cheaply but you do at least get what you pay for. Worth trying is The Big Pig Gig on Monday nights: an all-you-can-eat barbecue of ribs and chicken with beans, coleslaw and a beer for about £15.

IzEMkWpE-mDLEejloM1HkA.text: I had such a great night here last night, but this was lots to do with fabulous Qypers alongside a pretty nice place to eat. I congratulate whoever it was who came up with 'Qype Meat-up'. Brilliant idea. I was a wee bit late, but this is mostly London's fault. And also, it's a bit of a fib on the Big Easy website when they say that they're near Sloane Square. They're a 15 minute walk away! But we got there and I was handed a margerhita (strawberry. Very yummy. Not as strong as the blackberry ones.) Then I settled in on 'the cool table' - we were a bit group so we were split in two. I was all up for having steak, but then I spied the specials board and saw that they had scallops! (They do a fair bit of seafood so this isn't that strange). I am powerless before a scallop. Really. Once I've spied them on the menu, it isn't possible for me to focus on anything else. And they were brilliant. Slightly overcooked by my reckoning, but that's me being very fussy. There was lots of them about 8-10 which is a huge amount of scallops! My little basket of food actually looked quite tiny but I swear I couldn't have eaten another thing. Everyone seemed happy. I swapped coleslaw for The Duck's onion rings and well, they weren't brilliant, but then I swapped scallop for steak and that was brilliant. We were all very happy fat Qypers. The dessert menu wasn't brilliant. There was nothing that could tempt me, but by that time I was getting brain freeze from the frozen margs. It's difficult not to compare this place to Bodeans - where the first meat-up was - I liked the live music in here and the place had a bit more of an atmosphere. Staff were brilliant too. Friendly and helpful. But I think I preferred the food (and the prices) in Bodean's. But the evening was still great. Just jump on a bus from the tube to get here if you're running late and don't drink icey drinks to fast.

HZctObf-N2F0SZquyJ35YQ.text: Really great weekday lunch deals are available here. It's only £7.95 for 2 course meal! i have tried the Steamed Mussels and the Voodoo Wings for Starter! Both were huge portions and absolutely delicious! And for the mains, I have tried Baby Back Ribs, Steak Fajitas!!! Again, great dishes and gigantic portions!!! For big eaters out there this is really value for money!!!oh as for the setting. nice old American style!

pgD5uNWUpEE1XUAa2TrHPg.text: If like me you seem to be on a mission to find the best burger in town then look no further... I found this place when I first moved to the area 7 years ago and have been a regular ever since. Over the years I have probably tried everything on the menu and can say hand on heart that I haven't had a bad meal yet. I can recommend the Vodoo Wings to start followed by the Classic burger and if you have any room left (as the portions could fill a family of 4 I doubt it!) then you must try the Krispy Kreme Doughnut Fondue... To Die For!!! Personally I find the live music adds to the overall experience and an added bonus (Free Of Charge) is that there is always a group of people giddy on cocktails who wholeheartedly believe they sound good as they sing along to the band :) A great night is always had by all! Tip: The air con is always turned up full down stairs, take something warm to wear!

vNs722fZ-95db0A8uZmJZA.text: Want a good old taste of Louisiana? a good platter bigger than your table of succulent ribs and quantities that would make you smile unless you've been living in the south of the US? Well big easy that is! Named after the famous town of New Orleans, it managed to keep it's atmosphere while being on the King's road. I like to go there when I feel nostalgic of Texas!

lFDbWnGAjISw4SJsczJVgw.text: Although VERY American, it was pretty full for the early evening in the middle of a week, which is always a good sign and bought it some brownie points.I was on my first qype outing and the novelty of that overwhelmed the experience a littleThe food was good, the steak perfectly cooked although not warm. I was tempted by the ribs, and will be back to give it a try. The 2-4-1 cocktail special was tempting, but I stuck to my wine which was not half bad for by-the-glass. I found downstairs a little claustrophobic and the music was a little overwhelming, but the service was quick and friendly (although not mentioning the sauces were extra was a little below-the-belt).

1iuvtJ3snGl3WtZxLJxxDQ.text: Big, Easy, Chelsea. No, this isn't the booby prize of the posh, slightly fat girl with yo-yo knickers on a Friday night at 10-to-2. But a crab shack on Kings Road that offers authentic American cuisine (but then so does Burger King).I may sound slightly bitter and cynical but then so would you if you had just shared the most intimate of experiences with Kelly Brook only to be told by her the next day that the gates were now closed. The all you can eat fajitas (when offering shrimp) are possibly one of the greatest things known to man - after the Dyson Airblade that is. The steak is a char-grilled caramel affair on the outside and lipstick pink and plump when cut. The chicken dances with flavour like a Mexican flamenco and the shrimps are the size of tennis balls, in a sticky, sweet-chilli dip that creates (as the hairy bikers would put it) a flavour-bomb of goliath proportions. I felt like Henry VIII on his Birthday; minus the wives, of course. Sweating with excitement I ate until my eyes bulged and my belly swelled up like I had had a heavy night popping too much Silica gel. My next brush with 'Easy Chelsea' however was not as fun. She seemed a bit offish, uninterested and unconcerned about providing such a memorable experience again. I played it save by initiating the all you can eat jobby, I thought. This time however, when my plate had been revealed I could not see any trace of the delicate flesh I so desired and lusted after. Goodbye Mr Shrimp. Sweating, I asked the waitress why this Chelsea lass was being so coy and not surrendering to my carnal appetite? The Shrimp is no longer part of the dealio she replied, nonchalantly pursing her lips like a duck's bottom that had become wrinkled from the afternoon Sun. Now this is where Iphones come in handy. Cleverly  I fingered the website for this easy chick and up popped her vitals  All you can eat fajitas; Steak, Shrimp and Chicken. There she was showing her 'tic-tacs' in all their glory. I showed this to the waitress and then the Manager and after much debate I got my one last dying wish. For Shrimps. All three of them. And that was that. I didn't want to rock the boat, I guess, and try with my little puppies (my eyes that is) to obtain more of my fishy friends. Mr Shrimp received the royal pardon and did not end-up smothered in molten hot sweet-chilli sauce with a sharp metal rod shoved where the sun don't shine, showing everyone his breakfast. I was stuck with the chick-chick and the boeuf. I mean in any other restaurant I would have been satiated and I may have even campaigned to give the head chef a knighthood. But not the 'easy! Imagine going to a Thai massage parlour and been made to leave before the 'happy ending'. You would feel short changed and renounce the establishment for years to, er come. And unfortunately that's how Easy Chelsea left me reeling. If only she could get her act together and start offering the 'full service' again she would be worth another go. Until that time I'll be trying something other than just a shrimp tease.

AsTF7YNlfOSAzdiPBtvEWg.text: Amazing place for steak and lobster!! The atmosphere is loud and bustling. Really fun place to be on a weeknight in town - or weekend I could imagine. Always very busy and booking is a good idea, although I have been lucky the last times I went, as 2 people are much easier to seat than a big party. Live music some nights as well, which is cool. One place that I would say is a nice extra to the normal quiet and proper kings road restaurants.

5eaKg0l6mRU5X-2nhmpsGw.text: urgh...urghi do not rate this place at all.... if you are on a boys night and you all all boozed and shouting and dont mind eating some questionable food then this place is for you.

oqjc_7MNA16v4wV5QwTXLw.text: Fantastic meal for 2 last night, we didn't book so expected it to be busy, we were told we were looking at a 45 minute wait for a table which is fair enough but it was certainly worth it. Had a couple of the tasty frozen Margaritas at the bar while we waited and listened to the live music which is a nice touch. We were given a table withing 45 minutes so it's not like they were just trying to string out our waiting experience in the hope of shifting a couple more drinks, it was genuinely rammed (in a nice way!)Ordered 2 Lobsters and the waitor was very helpful in advising us on the sauces that come with the dish. The food was on the table within 10 minutes and was fantastic! I'm no expert on lobster but would definitely have it again except for the fact i found myself almost salivating over trays of all you can eat fajitas that were coming from the kitchen.. will try those next time.Next time I will be sure to book!

K8NO8-q6tsFYh92fLYyPYg.text: It's a pretty good sampling of Americana. However, there's a reason I moved away from that continent. :-) My steak was decent, and reasonably priced (as a Tuesday night special). The chips were very good. And the special comes with a glass of wine. The wine list was extensive. The menu's large, and other people report that ther lobster was good. The ribs were large and reportedly good, too. Upstairs seems to get a bit of a vibe boost from having the bar and the windows to the street. Downstairs is just a big room of people chowing down. Biggest complaint: the recorded music was too loud and a bit on the annoying side. A couple of guys with guitars came on about 8:30pm to play a set of easy-listening (Brown Eyed Girl, etc) tunes downstairs which was a bit better. You get lots of food, and there's lots of choice. But the whole place is a bit too earnest, cluttered and American for me to really enjoy it.

4Y0D4GFZqsmwkr9nmtq56w.text: Walking up to the door you can see the medals worn round the neck (signs above the door to you and me) of this establishment. They are proud of stocking for and serving the US Forces in Europe, being rated as one of the best 3 steak restuarants in London according to the Metro newspaper amongst other tags and titles picked up over the years. No beers on draught and unable to drink bottled beer when I know how much they are at wholesale prices, I saw the margaritas in slush puppie style machines and ordered a Blackberry one. I recieved two and notification that these were the rules of 'happy hour'. They were amazingmaybe too amazing. I say that because whilst other Qypers at our downstairs restuarant table said that they would get anyone drunk, I laughed as I couldnt taste booze, it was just refreshing fruit and sugar to my tastebuds. Just before the £15 Tuesday night steak and drink special arrived, I was quite drunk. I couldnt beleive it. Poisioned. Disgraceful. Then a gorgeous glass of Malbec arrived under my nose my the ever so smiley waitress. Brilliant. Without much delay my 8oz steak arrived. I was starving having missed lunch and it was really good. Cooked perfectly as I had requested so I would rate their steak here on both taste and decancy grounds. Although as it was a cheapo offer I got the billed couple of salad leaves, small to medium size portion of chips and onion rings which were wholly dissapointing, though large. A band came onto the stage behind me and delivered covers, whilst the lovely Siany swapped Scallop and slaw for steak. Gorgeousthe food is really good here. As the meal was finished and (mostly) empty plates from happy eaters were collected I made a beeline for that important after dinner smoke. Good shelter for smokers too even if it is under a little awning on the street. The toilets (restrooms) were a little odd. The band playing live downstairs were piped through speakers into the toilet. Never had I expereinced that before. Not even somewhere like a concert venue where you pay to hear the musicians perform. Good trick I think as I take in the Americana all over the walls in the toilet. Nice to see the theme being kept to at all times, because as others would have noted this place is very Americana. As I return downstairs I see a snippet from an undated Evening standard newspaper article about the big easy's 3,500 calorie £40 2lb steak and lobster meal. It takes 25 mins to cook the steak because of its size!!! Madness! It is temping for one day but in the meantime I think I will just get some Monday night all-you-can-eat rib for £15 practise in before the 2008 rib rack contest title is held. Of course I will be arriving early for 2 for 1 margaritas and booking the table for 7.30pm. Anyone want to join me?

FoLlcSaH2Ho3YTrVGqFXhw.text: Although it is busy nearly all the time really cant say its value for money.Well Take it or leave it ( I have worked there )

vKnJVt9q2dDdqxPcotchwg.text: Haven't eaten a full meal here, so the stars are for the many margaritas to choose from, suitably fattening chicken skewers, US sport of the TV and the friendly bar staff. I came here in a Christmas shopping daze, to refuel and have a couple drinks. My Californian male friend was suitably lulled by the sport and after an hour or so we were ready to face the crowds again.

Gt4H4I8p6HSoob8UgTAPyA.text: This place is awesome. If you want to absolutely stuff your face with great tasting American food then look no further. Two words: Fajitas, Ribs. That's all you need to know. Mondays for Ribs and Wednesdays for Faijtas. For 15 quid you get all you can eat AND a drink. Not only that, they may even let you take home a whole extra portion of Fajitas. Who does that on an 'all you can eat' deal!? It sucks there is only one location and that you have it trek it down Kings Road for 20 minutes to get there from the tube but man is it worth it. The food is good quality. It's not the Ritz but it definitely delivers. You may not realize how difficult it is to find steak in this City that's chewable without spending next year's bonus but that's what you get and so much more. I'm sure this reads like a ridiculous rant but that's what this place deserves. Having said all that, if you show up and order something other than ribs or fajitas off the a la carte menu I can't vouch for it, hence the 4 stars instead of 5. Go on diners, enjoy.
